result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurtis James Kollath

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kurtis James Kollath in court. Def had PT with DA; reached agreement. Def forgot paperwork for DPA. Case passed and recalled. Atty. Jeanette Corbett now appears for State. Def pleads guilty; judgment is deferred and court accepts DPA. Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 12, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on July 12, 2023 at 09:45 am.
No contact with A.M.K. or her residence except through a third party to arrange child visits and except for court proceedings.

Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kurtis James Kollath in court. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Def waives counsel to PT with DA. Plea hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
